intro: Tounatea floribunda, commonly known as the golden flame tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, orange-yellow inflorescences that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a fibrous covering. Tounatea floribunda thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental species in warm climates. Its rapid growth and vibrant floral display make it a striking addition to gardens and landscapes.
